alert.note: Alert for Park; Sweet Grass (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 14 at 10:45AM MDT until June 15 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS Billings
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Montana... Yellowstone River near Livingston affecting Sweet Grass and Park Counties. ...The Flood Warning is cancelled for the following rivers in Montana... Yellowstone River at Corwin Springs affecting Park County. .Drier weather is allowing river levels to fall and they will continue to fall on the Yellowstone today from south to north. Water levels will remain high and the rivers are still danger especially in areas where flood damage may have occurred. For the Yellowstone River...including Corwin Springs, Livingston minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY TOMORROW AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. T * WHERE...Yellowstone River near Livingston. * WHEN...Until early tomorrow afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, Some minor overflow occurs along the lowest areas throughout the reach of the river and across the road connecting the island with the rest of town. At 10.0 feet, Roads to Mill Creek, Cinnabar Basin and Trail Creek are covered with water. Water will also be over portions of Yellowstone Park road for 800 yards, 3.5 miles south of town, including a few farm homes. Flooding over the road to 9th Street island with water reaching some homes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:45 AM MDT Tuesday the stage was 10.5 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 9:45 AM MDT Tuesday was 12.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this evening and continue falling to 8.5 feet Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Wed Thu Fri Yellowstone River Livingston 10.0 10.5 Tue 9 am 8.7 7.9 8.4 &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Be aware of erosion and damage to infrastructure. Please report observed flooding to local emergency officials and request they pass the information to the National Weather Service in Billings. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. The latest stages and forecasts for rivers and streams can be found at our web page: water.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by this morning at 1145 AM MDT.
